name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pile Card
Specification Reference - ASG (SESOC NZGS) Bored Pile Spec Cl 3.9
○ Description of material encountered at regular 1m intervals and when new layers encountered (Specifically record depth at which Rock level is found)
○ Time and depth at which obstructions were encountered.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check verticality using digital level
Acceptance Criteria - Verticality Tolerance - No greater than 1:75 (Horizontal: Vertical)
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Agreement of Final Socket Depth
Acceptance Criteria - Rock depth to be confirmed by the Engineer with guidance from the contractor and drill operators. Rock depth to be noted on the pile card. Pile card shall be signed by Engineer.
○ Following establishment of Rock Depth, Engineer to confirm socket depth
Verifying Document - Pile Card & ConQA Sign-off
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Shaft cleanliness CCTV
Specification Reference - ASG (SESOC NZGS) Bored Pile Spec Cl 3.8 & PS CL 24.5.5
Acceptance Criteria - Casing inspected visually using mirrors and spotlights as required. CCTV to be used for rock socket. Suitable flocculant to be used, as necessary,
Verifying Document - CCTV Footage & ConQA Sign-off
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Final measurement of pile length
Specification Reference - ASG (SESOC NZGS) Bored Pile Spec Cl 3.8 & PS CL 24.5.4
Acceptance Criteria - Following completion of rock socket and cleaning. Pile depth to be measured and noted on the pile card
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Reinforcing cage placing
○ Cage length measure and trimmed to size to maintain bottom cover
Verifying Document - Pile Card & ConQA Sign-off
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Spacer Wheel Installation
Acceptance Criteria - 4no. wheels per 4-5m vertically (2x sets on pile P2) and on 4 sides of the cage Horizontally i.e. at 12, 3, 6 & 9 on a clock face
Verifying Document - Pile Card, Photos & ConQA Sign-off
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Top hook level/cage levelling
Acceptance Criteria - Measure top of pile concrete to top of hooks to ensure correct cage level.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pre-pour Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Pre-pour inspection with Engineer Sign-off
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Test Cylinders

Acceptance Criteria - A set of specimens for compression tests shall consist of 4 specimens from each sample of concrete. 1no. tested at 7 days and 3no. tested at 28 days. (Actual spec requirement is 3no. At 28days)
○ Slump test must also be carried out
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Tremie pour mix Bored Piles and Hard Piles
Acceptance Criteria - Correct mix design brought to site
○ Concrete placement method that the mix was designed for - Tremie
○ Type of supplementary cementitious materials (if used);
○ Slump (target and actual slump when measured);
○ Associated Products e.g. cement and additives
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Slump Test
Acceptance Criteria - Slump tests shall be taken for each truckload of concrete and when compressive testing samples are taken.
○ Slump spread test if slump could exceed 210mm
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pour Height above top of pile
Acceptance Criteria - Minimum over-cast of 0.3m to be measured against mark on casing.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Engineer Sign-off
Acceptance Criteria - Sign off of Pile Card
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - PIT Testing

Acceptance Criteria - Specialist external testing contractor to provide analysis of the pile identifying any flaws, the method used to determine them, and an interpretation of their significance. Report to be sent to the Engineer for review.
Frequency - Per Pile - min 7 days Post Pour
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Survey as-built
Acceptance Criteria - Not more than 75mm horizontally and 25mm vertically from their true position.
Verifying Document - As-built survey CAD File
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to works
Acceptance Criteria - Must include but not limited to:
○ Pile casing installation methodology and equipment;
○ Bored pile spoil excavation methodology and equipment, including disposal requirements;
○ Cover Spacers type and detail sheet;
○ Methodology for pile base clean-out and inspection requirements;
○ Methodology for placement of concrete underwater;
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to installation
Acceptance Criteria - Reinforcing bars shall be cut and bent according to NZS 3109, Section 3 and NZS 3101, Section 8.4 to the dimensions and shapes as shown or indicated on the Drawings.
○ Bend diameters for longitudinal reinforcing shall be in accordance with Table 3.1, NZS 3109 and Table 8.1, NZS 3101. Stirrups shall be bent to standard shapes as shown in NZS 3109.
○ Cage Inspection with Engineer at Fabrication Yard
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to installation
Acceptance Criteria - The external diameter at any section, measured using a steel tape on the circumference, shall not differ from the theoretical diameter by more than ±1%.
○ The deviation from straightness on any longitudinal face shall not exceed 1/600 of the length of the pile, nor 5 mm in any 3000mm length.

○ The out-of- round (i.e. difference in measurements of two diagonals at right angles) of a casing must not exceed 1% of the internal diameter, provided that the concrete cover specified on the Drawings is maintained.
○ Steel cast numbers, mill certificates, test certificates and ladle analyses to be retained and included in As-built details
Verifying Document - Dockets, Mill Certs, Site Measurements
